task.title: Auto-delete Log Files - macOS & Linux
task.shortdesc: Using a Cron Job, the OBS Studio log files can be scheduled for auto-deletion.These steps cannot be validated as I am using Windows.

taskbody.context: Refer to the below mentioned steps to auto-delete log files older than a month (30 days).

step.cmd: Using a Cron Job, Open Terminal (Cmd + Space, type Terminal, press Enter).
Edit the crontab file by running: crontab -e
Add this line at the end to remove OBS logs older than 30 days: 0 0 * * * find ~/.config/obs-studio/logs -type f -name "*.txt" -mtime +30 -delete
On macOS, change the path to: "0 0 * * * find ~/Library/Application\ Support/obs-studio/logs -type f -name "*.txt" -mtime +30 -delete".
In the nano editor, press Ctrl +X, then Y, and Enter to save.
